summary: Hello turtle paced!  Is not strange bran is so focused about telling Jon his origins? Given it will be a shock if I was bran  I...
question: Hello turtle paced!  Is not strange bran is so focused about telling Jon his origins? Given it will be a shock if I was bran  I could consider avoid  my loving brother a so big sorrow. Moreover  how this revelation helps all against the walkers ? Sure it does not help with the northern lords. Bye
answer:
Jon’s Targaryen heritage could provide the forces of the living with another dragonrider, which is definitely a benefit for them all. 

I also understand why someone would feel compelled to reveal the truth to Jon - not from politics but from love. Jon has wanted to know who his mother was all his life. In the show, Ned promised to tell him and talk to him about it, and Jon was deprived of that opportunity. Even if the truth is hard for Jon to hear, that doesn’t mean he shouldn’t get to hear it.

This is assuming, however, Bran’s acting from a place of love rather than functioning as a plot device again. The show has done very poorly by this character. (What, is he not in the trailer because the wheelchair would ruin the ~aesthetic~? Or are we just being open about the fact that Bran’s been demoted from character status now?)

summary: Bran is not a Stark anymore. He's the Night King, and he has no claims over Winterfell. There were dozens of ways to include him...
question: Bran is not a Stark anymore. He's the Night King, and he has no claims over Winterfell. There were dozens of ways to include him without ruining the 'aesthetic'. Like, I agree that ableism is a problem but I think you guys are barking up to wrong tree here.
answer:
Imo Bran’s got an interesting storyline bc it diverges from normal fantasy stuff. I love Arya, but what she went through is a giant trope. But Bran? His whole journey was very weird, and the fact he wasn’t truly interested in any of it makes it even more peculiar. I honestly can’t wait to see what’s going to happen with him. 

I feel like you and I are talking entirely different languages. I’m trying to give you the benefit of the doubt, but how is Bran not a Stark??

umm… friendly reminder that all of the stark kids have rejected their stark identity at some point or the other (“I am Alayne, Father. Who else would I be?” / “No one. I am no one. Just a blind girl, just a servant of Him of Many Faces.” / “Yes,“ he said, hesitantly, "kings have legitimized bastards before, but… I am still a brother of the Night’s Watch. I knelt before a heart tree and swore to hold no lands and father no children.”)

So, unless all of them are no longer Starks… Bran is still a Stark.

More importantly, Bran is the Night King?!?!?! WHEN?!?!? When did this happen? So, next season is going to be just Night King Bran versus. the original Night King? What are you talking about?

I am confused.

Ableism is a problem, but as long as the show-runners are doing it, don’t take it to heart and stop barking up the wrong tree… is a very weird defense. I genuinely don’t know how to respond to that.

Bran has a very typical fantasy trope development, as far as I know.

A young lord/prince, who wanted to be a knight, but tragedy befalls him, an he can’t remain in status quo, and has to go out of his comfort zone (winterfell) and he goes on a quest for knowledge, that will ultimately allow him to save the world…..   like, this is the TYPICAL HERO’S JOURNEY, if I am not mistaken.

Also, if your idea of an exciting character arc is someone go through a journey while the said character is not at all being interested or invested in it…. uh, I don’t know how to help you.

 So, in short

summary: starklings names:  brandon “bran” stark: mythic. brandon “bran the builder” stark is a legendary figure from the age of heroes....
body:
starklings names:

brandon “bran” stark:

mythic. brandon “bran the builder” stark is a legendary figure from the age of heroes. he is the founder of house stark and builder of winterfell as well as several other key structures (allegedly). its the classic name for stark kings. 

jon snow:

common. its like the jon smith of westeros. it doesnt get less noble than that. however his true name is aegon targaryen (I GUESS???) which has significant historical value. its a name for conquerors and kings. 

arya stark

unique. there’s only one arya stark. arya’s first name is taken from her great great grandmother who was a flint. but among the starks arya is the first to bear that name (officially). arya isn’t following in anyone’s footsteps. she’s one of a kind.

summary:
Bran: Well, some of you will probably die this season.
Sansa: Some of us? You're not included?
Bran: Precisely.
Jon: Explain,...
body:
Bran: Well, some of you will probably die this season.

Sansa: Some of us? You’re not included?

Bran: Precisely.

Jon: Explain, please.

Bran: Because they’re called the white WALKERS.

Arya: he does have a point.

blog.name: sometimesrosy
blog.title: sometimes pissy again hold on i'm trying to chill
blog.description: Rowena. Writer. Artist.Mom. Intersectional feminist. Dedicated sf/fantasy fan. The 100 obsessed. Bellarke shipper. Ship and let ship PLEASE. B99. Positivity and Empowerment. No shipwars, no fanwars, no character hate, no writer hate. rosymamacita on AO3 .  play nice or leave.

summary: oh my everyone part of me  included is freaking out with the got teaser and the stark brothers together how nice and then i am...
question: oh my everyone part of me  included is freaking out with the got teaser and the stark brothers together how nice and then i am oh my they are gonna die two of them one of them this is got is not gonna end well, but what if they all survive will be a unexpected plot twist, no it's got that's impossible but what if, oh my god thats me until april and then you add the 100 and i'm lost this shows are gonna end with us seriously i hate them ,not really.
answer:
I feel like I haven’t seen a trailer with Bran, so I might have missed one. 

A lot of people die on GOT. True true. It’s part of the story. And if you play the game of thrones you win or you die. Some die and come back, like Jon. 

I think actually though, that Bran’s story is different from everyone else’s? I think you might actually count Bran as one of those people who died and came back, but he came back changed. Reborn. He’s The Three Eyed Crow. He’s still Bran Stark, but he’s not. His life means something else now. He ceded Winterfell to Sansa. His path is different. 

He never actually played the game of thrones though. He wan’t interested. He was a little boy looking for adventure when he was pushed from the tower and died the first time. He didn’t really die, but his life as son of Winterfell kind of did. But he REALLY died when he went beyond the wall and went on that spiritual trip. The magic took him. He’s no longer a boy, he’s a mystic. 

I’m not sure he GETS to die anymore. His life isn’t really his own. 

Not sure if that makes you feel better or worse though.

I feel like I haven’t seen a trailer with Bran, so I might have missed one. 

A lot of people die on GOT. True true. It’s part of the story. And if you play the game of thrones you win or you die. Some die and come back, like Jon. 

I think actually though, that Bran’s story is different from everyone else’s? I think you might actually count Bran as one of those people who died and came back, but he came back changed. Reborn. He’s The Three Eyed Crow. He’s still Bran Stark, but he’s not. His life means something else now. He ceded Winterfell to Sansa. His path is different. 

He never actually played the game of thrones though. He wan’t interested. He was a little boy looking for adventure when he was pushed from the tower and died the first time. He didn’t really die, but his life as son of Winterfell kind of did. But he REALLY died when he went beyond the wall and went on that spiritual trip. The magic took him. He’s no longer a boy, he’s a mystic. 

I’m not sure he GETS to die anymore. His life isn’t really his own. 

Not sure if that makes you feel better or worse though.
trail.content:
I feel like I haven’t seen a trailer with Bran, so I might have missed one. 

A lot of people die on GOT. True true. It’s part of the story. And if you play the game of thrones you win or you die. Some die and come back, like Jon. 

I think actually though, that Bran’s story is different from everyone else’s? I think you might actually count Bran as one of those people who died and came back, but he came back changed. Reborn. He’s The Three Eyed Crow. He’s still Bran Stark, but he’s not. His life means something else now. He ceded Winterfell to Sansa. His path is different. 

He never actually played the game of thrones though. He wan’t interested. He was a little boy looking for adventure when he was pushed from the tower and died the first time. He didn’t really die, but his life as son of Winterfell kind of did. But he REALLY died when he went beyond the wall and went on that spiritual trip. The magic took him. He’s no longer a boy, he’s a mystic.

blog.name: fortunatelylori
blog.title: Thoughts on the verge
blog.description:
Pretty much Game of Throne and Jonsa all day, every day. 
Avatar and header by @ragekitn

summary: I believe the reason that bran isn’t in the new trailer is that he’s the three eyed raven now, and has “left” Bran behind in...
question: I believe the reason that bran isn’t in the new trailer is that he’s the three eyed raven now, and has “left” Bran behind in that cave. Hence he doesn’t consider himself a stark anymore?
answer:
Hey, nonnie!

I’ve seen people speculate the same. It might be that. Honestly, I think they just wanted to drive home the Aegon/Visenya/Rhaenys parallel and didn’t want to muddle the waters with Bran. Also, I do think the trailer has more to do with the Dance of Dragons and not the White Walkers despite the mist. 

Still, people suggested they could have included Bran in the form of a raven and I think they should have gone with that. But, alas, they didn’t …

I just hope Bran has a satisfying and interesting end game. He’s been on this journey of self-discovery and knowledge for 7 seasons, all with the purpose of defeating the NK. He needs to be instrumental in that fight and for it all to be explained satisfactorily. 

I keep thinking that one of the reasons why they’re keeping us in the dark about Bran and his abilities is perhaps because they won’t explain much even in season 8. HBO does have “The Long Night” series in production so part of me thinks some of the mysteries and intricacies of Bran/WW/NK will not be resolved in this final season in order to hook people to tune into the new series. I hope I’m wrong and they don’t keep Bran as solely the wikipedia of Westeros, who in some explainable way does something that defeats the NK at some point … 

Maybe it isn’t that … maybe they have a special Bran/NK teaser set-up and that’s why they didn’t include him here. I guess we can’t know that for sure at the moment. We’ll just have to wait and see what they bring out next. 

Thanks for the ask!

blog.name: wintersqueen
blog.title: Queen in the North
blog.description:
Sam | 28 | Female 
Sansa is the queen in the North
I talk more on twitter
netflix spoiler tags for 2 weeks

summary:
coming into this final stretch, people need to rid themselves of this
 “useless character” idea. This short of episodes, this...
body:
coming into this final stretch, people need to rid themselves of this “useless character” idea. This short of episodes, this short of time, there isn’t any time for useless characters or filler episodes. everything is going to serve a purpose and every character will serve a role.

so get rid of this “bran is useless because he doesn’t do anything” idea.

bran, who’s entire plot revolves around the NK. bran, who is the only character capable of magic(in the show). bran, who is going to be the one who defeats the NK.

so get rid of this “sansa is useless because she doesn’t have a weapon” idea.

sansa, who’s entire plot has revolved around learning both Southern and Northern politics. sansa, who is the only character to have strong connections in almost every kingdom. sansa, who is going to be on the throne at the end.

additionally, get rid of the idea that dany is somehow going to be both savior and queen, when both of those roles have already been filled by Starks.Her role has already been stated: she’s a conqueror, not a queen.
